edu.rit.pj2.tracker

Class NodeProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.tracker.NodeProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable

    public class NodeProperties
extends java.lang.Object
implements Streamable
    Class NodeProperties encapsulates the capabilities a computational node must have in order to run a certain PJ2 Task as part of a PJ2 Job. The following capabilities may be specified:
    • nodeName — The name of the node needed.
    • cores — The number of CPU cores needed.
    • gpus — The number of GPU accelerators needed.
    • gpuIds — The specific GPU IDs needed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALL_CORES
      Indicates that the task requires all the cores on the node.
      static int ALL_GPUS
      Indicates that the task requires all the GPU accelerators on the node.
      static java.lang.String ANY_NODE_NAME
      Indicates that the task can run on any node of the cluster.
      static int DEFAULT_CORES
      Indicates that the cores property is defaulted.
      static int DEFAULT_GPUS
      Indicates that the gpus property is defaulted.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_NODE_NAME
      Indicates that the nodeName property is defaulted.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeProperties

        public NodeProperties()
        Construct a new node properties object. All settings are defaulted.

      • NodeProperties

        public NodeProperties(NodeProperties node)
        Construct a new node properties object that is a copy of the given node properties object.
        Parameters:
        node - Node properties object to copy.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if node is null.

      • NodeProperties

        public NodeProperties(java.lang.String capabilities)
        Construct a new node properties object with capabilities specified by the given string. The capabilities string must be in the format "name,cores,gpus", where name is the name of the node, cores is the number of CPU cores in the node (≥ 1), and gpus is either an integer giving the number of GPU accelerators in the node (≥ 0) or a parenthesized comma-separated list of one or more integers giving the IDs of the GPU accelerators in the node.
        Parameters:
        capabilities - Capabilities string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if capabilities is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if capabilities is illegal.

    • Method Detail

      • nodeName

        public NodeProperties nodeName(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Set the nodeName property. The nodeName property specifies the name of the cluster node on which the task must run.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Node name, ANY_NODE_NAME, or DEFAULT_NODE_NAME.
        Returns:
        This node properties object.
        See Also:
        nodeName()

      • nodeName

        public java.lang.String nodeName()
        Get the nodeName property. The nodeName property specifies the name of the cluster node on which the task must run. If the nodeName property is defaulted, ANY_NODE_NAME is returned, indicating that the task can run on any node of the cluster.
        Returns:
        Node name, or ANY_NODE_NAME.
        See Also:
        nodeName(String)

      • cores

        public NodeProperties cores(java.lang.String s)
        Set the cores property from the given string. The cores property specifies the number of CPU cores the task requires.
        Parameters:
        s - Number of cores (integer string ≥ 1).
        Returns:
        This node properties object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if s is illegal.
        See Also:
        cores()

      • cores

        public NodeProperties cores(int cores)
        Set the cores property. The cores property specifies the number of CPU cores the task requires.
        Parameters:
        cores - Number of cores (≥ 1), ALL_CORES, or DEFAULT_CORES.
        Returns:
        This node properties object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if cores is illegal.
        See Also:
        cores()

      • cores

        public int cores()
        Get the cores property. The cores property specifies the number of CPU cores the task requires. If the cores property is defaulted, ALL_CORES is returned, indicating that the task requires all the cores on the node.
        Returns:
        Number of cores (≥ 1), or ALL_CORES.
        See Also:
        cores(int)

      • gpus

        public NodeProperties gpus(java.lang.String s)
        Set the gpus and gpuIDs properties from the given string. If s is a single integer ≥ 0, it gives the number of GPU accelerators the task requires, and any GPU IDs may be used. If s is a parenthesized comma-separated list of one or more integers, it gives the specific GPU IDs the task requires.
        Parameters:
        s - Number of GPUs (integer string ≥ 0), or list of GPU IDs.
        Returns:
        This node properties object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if s is illegal.
        See Also:
        gpus()

      • gpus

        public NodeProperties gpus(int gpus)
        Set the gpus property. The gpus property specifies the number of GPU accelerators the task requires. Any GPU IDs may be used.
        Parameters:
        gpus - Number of GPUs (≥ 0), ALL_GPUS, or DEFAULT_GPUS.
        Returns:
        This node properties object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if gpus is illegal.
        See Also:
        gpus()

      • gpus

        public int gpus()
        Get the gpus property. The gpus property specifies the number of GPU accelerators the task requires. If the gpus property is defaulted, 0 is returned, indicating that the task requires no GPU accelerators.
        Returns:
        Number of GPUs (≥ 0).
        See Also:
        gpus(int)

      • gpuIDs

        public NodeProperties gpuIDs(int[] gpuIDs)
        Set the gpuIDs property. The gpuIDs property specifies the GPU IDs the task requires.
        Parameters:
        gpuIDs - Array of GPU IDs the task requires. If null or zero-length, the task requires no GPU accelerators.
        Returns:
        This node properties object.
        See Also:
        gpuIDs()

      • gpuIDs

        public int[] gpuIDs()
        Get the gpuIDs property. The gpuIDs property specifies the GPU IDs the task requires. If the task requires no GPU accelerators, or if the task may use any GPU IDs, null is returned.
        Returns:
        Array of GPU IDs the task requires, or null.
        See Also:
        gpuIDs(int[])
